image.title: Lailah Ryklief, Author at Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy

item.title: Long commute to freedom
item.dc:creator: Lailah Ryklief
item.description:
Black people in particular bear the brunt of a decade-long focus on building houses instead of cities “at whatever cost”.

The post Long commute to freedom appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: What’s killing our children?
item.dc:creator: Lailah Ryklief
item.description:
By the time the sun sets, at least one child in South Africa will have decided to take their own life; another will have died because of violence; five will have lost their lives because of accidents; and 12 will have succumbed to various illnesses.

The post What’s killing our children? appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Timeline: Thuli Madonsela’s Big Five
item.dc:creator: Lailah Ryklief
item.description:
Outgoing Public Protector Thuli Madonsela has investigated some of the most high profile politicians in the country, including President Jacob Zuma. (Click on the arrows for more detail)

The post Timeline: Thuli Madonsela’s Big Five appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The Forgotten People
item.dc:creator: Lailah Ryklief
item.description:
Thousands of people in 97 informal settlements were not counted in the 2011 census, a data-driven investigation has revealed.

The post The Forgotten People appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.
